column2: This factory turns steel, machine parts, rubber goods and fuel into automobiles, the choice of transportation of the rich and famous. In addition to being a luxury good, it is used to equip tank and airplane brigades.

A radio allows instantaneous wireless communication over long distances, and effortless reception of the same transmission by many. It is thus a whole new medium of mass communication, and a major consumer good. This factory makes radios out of electric gear.
The telephone is a major breakthrough in communications technology. This factory builds telephones out of electric gear.

This factory uses iron, glass and chemical minerals to produce electric components, electromechanical devices, and various related accessories. Electric gear is needed to produce radios and telephones, and used as a luxury good to electrify homes.

Using self-powered machinery to do work rather than doing it yourself is what industrialization is about, and this factory exists to provide that machinery. Machines are built out of steel in this factory, and used to build other factories.

Using self-powered machinery to do work rather than doing it yourself is what industrialization is about, and this factory exists to provide that machinery. Machines are built out of steel, and need lubricant to keep friction from overheating them or wearing them apart.
The fuel refinery processes crude oil into liquid fuel used for a variety of purposes, particularly powering automobiles.

Steamships use steam engines to propel them, allowing them not only to sail regardless of the wind but also provides much greater propulsive power, allowing steamers to be built heavier and sturdier. Steamers are produced from steel, lumber and machine parts, and fueled by coal.
Silk is the preferred luxury textile of the age. This factory uses silk and fabric to produce luxury clothing for wealthy customers.
Iron is smelted and mixed with coal to produce steel at this factory. Being used for both construction and machinery, steel is a vital resource that no emergent industrial power should be without.
This factory casts, bores and assembles artillery guns of various types from steel. Artillery is required to arm a navy, and is an important support weapon for an army.

Even as steam-powered warships rendered sailships obsolete for combat, sailships retained their usefulness for merchant shipping due to requiring no fuel for propulsion. Building sailships requires lumber for the hull and fabric for the sails and rigging.

Small arms are produced from steel and lumber here. As small arms are what the core of a country's army is equipped with, this factory is essential for a country striving for military self-sufficiency.
Furniture is made here from lumber. It is a necessity for every home and thus in demand by the entire population regardless of income.
A paper mill uses chemicals to break down timber into a fibrous pulp, which is then reformed into sheets of paper. Paper is used mainly for bookkeeping and distribution of the written word.
This factory uses fabric to produce cheap, utilitarian clothing for the general populace.
This factory turns iron and chemicals into a wide range of different types of ammunition, from rifle cartridges to artillery shells.

Canning is the preservation of food by temporarily sterilizing it and sealing it in airtight metal cans. It is a relatively convenient and cost-efficient method of food preservation and thus, canned food is used to feed urban populations and troops in the field. This factory turns livestock into canned food.

Canning is the preservation of food by temporarily sterilizing it and sealing it in airtight metal cans. It is a relatively convenient and cost-efficient method of food preservation and thus, canned food is used to feed urban populations and troops in the field. This factory turns fish into canned food.

Beer has been brewed from grain since time immemorial, and this factory uses the latest industrial technology to do it more efficiently than ever before. Beer is an everyday consumer good consumed in large amounts by all strata of society.
Wine is a luxury beverage produced by fermenting fruit. It is consumed by the rich, and by lower classes should they obtain the means to do so.
Whisky is liquor produced by fermenting grain and distilling the result. The outcome is a luxury good consumed by wealthy consumers.
A lumber mill saws raw timber into lumber. Lumber is used to build a wide range of things, from countryside houses to kitchen tables to warships.
A cotton mill weaves, bleaches, dyes and looms cotton into fabric. It is, arguably, the factory that started the whole Industrial Revolution.
A wool mill weaves, bleaches, dyes and looms wool from wool-producing livestock into fabric.

Cement is made by heating clay and limestone in a kiln, and grinding it to a fine powder. It is, along with steel, the material that the growing industrial cities of the age are built of. It is used to build factories and used as a consumer good to build housing, mainly by craftsmen, clerks and capitalists.

Glass is produced in a coal-powered kiln from silica mixed with various minerals. It is mainly used as a consumer good in the form of windows, mirrors and glassware, but also as an industrial intermediate good.
Confectionery is a catch-all term for sweet food products: Candy, cakes, pastries, biscuits, chocolate. It is a good consumed by all strata of the population.

The industrial age created a whole new need for reliable lubrication of machines, and palm oil is particularly well suited for the purpose. This factory turns palm oil into lubricant and related products such as lamp oil. Lubricant is required for the maintenance of factories as well as consumed by the strata able to afford luxury goods.
The industrial age created a whole new need for reliable lubrication of machines, and the oil of sperm whales is particularly well suited for the purpose. This factory turns fish into lubricant.

The invention of vacuum distillation enabled the production of high-quality lubricant from crude petroleum. This factory does just that, turning crude oil into lubricant for industrial use and other miscellaneous oil products for consumer use, such as photogene.

Vulcanization enabled rubber to be used to produce goods that are simultaneously elastic, waterproof and wear-resistant. This led to the appearance of a wide range of rubber goods, such as footwear, insulation, and tires. This factory turns rubber into rubber goods.

A chemical industry produces a wide range of products, such as paints, dyes, soda, lye and nitroglycerin. The chemical plant turns raw chemical minerals into refined chemicals, an input of many other factories.
Soap is what keeps people and places clean, and thus is an everyday consumer good for the entire population. In this factory, soap is made from palm oil and alkaline chemicals.
This factory uses crude oil to produce various plastic goods for the consumer market.

Manufactured cigarettes are a cheap, convenient alternative for those who cannot afford proper cigars but who are willing to pay for not having to roll their own smokes. This factory makes cigarettes out of tobacco and paper.
This factory produces pharmaceuticals for the medical needs of the population. Everyone falls ill from time to time, though whether they can afford medication is another matter.
A printing press imprints the written word onto paper, using chemicals such as inks and pigments, producing goods such as books, newspapers and propaganda pamphlets.

Charcoal is what you get when wood is heated while deprived of oxygen to prevent combustion. While less economically efficient than mining, charcoal-burning provides an alternative coal source for countries lacking mines of their own.
Using coal, the synthetic oil factory produces oil. Useful for nations that do not have ready access to oil but still need it badly.

Steamships use steam engines to propel them, allowing them not only to sail regardless of the wind but also provides much greater propulsive power, allowing steamers to be built heavier and sturdier. Steamers are produced from steel, lumber and machine parts, and fueled by coal.
Furniture is made here from lumber. It is a necessity for every home and thus in demand by the entire population regardless of income.

The industrial age created a whole new need for reliable lubrication of machines. The oil of sperm whales was particularly well suited for the purpose, and prominently used until petroleum-based lubricants became widely available. It also had a secondary use as a very clean lamp oil. This factory uses ships to catch and haul in whales for processing into oil products. Oil products are required for the maintenance of factories as well as consumed by the strata able to afford luxury goods.

Mother, why don't we have a McCormick reaper? Everyone else has one nowadays!'\n\nSeveral mechanical tools were developed for agriculture in the early 19th century for  tasks such as sowing, reaping, threshing and forestry.
column4: 'Mutter, warum haben wir noch keinen McCormick-Mähdrescher? Jeder andere hat schon einen!'\n\nIm frühen 19. Jahrhundert wurden diverse mechanische Werkzeuge für die Landwirtschaft entwickelt: zum säen, ernten, dreschen oder die Forstwirtschaft.

column2: Mother! Did you hear! There's a thing in the mine which lifts rock up shafts all by its own!'\n\nOne of the first uses of steam power was to haul loads of ore out of mines, and this early manifestation of the Industrial Revoluton has arrived in the mines around $PROVINCENAME$.
column4: 'Mutter, hörst du das? Da ist ein neues Ding in der Mine, welches die Steine von ganz alleine bewegt.'\n\nEine der ersten Einsätze für Dampfmaschinen war der Transport des Erzes aus den Minen. Diese frühe Entwicklung der Industriellen Revolution hat nun Einzug gehalten in die Minen von $PROVINCENAME$.

column2: Mother, what are those little white grains Father has been strewing over the field? \n\nInorganic fertilizers produced by the nascent chemical industry allow for higher yields per area than before, as well as makes the cultivation of less fertile soil commercially viable.

This was the first semi-automatic loom. With a single operator action, it kept weaving until the shuttle ran out of thread. Consequently, a single worker could operate several looms simultaneously, increasing productivity.
column4: This was the first semi-automatic loom. With a single operator action, it kept weaving until the shuttle ran out of thread. Consequently, a single worker could operate several looms simultaneously, increasing productivity.

column2: A lockstitch seam is one consisting of two threads on opposite sides of the cloth, held in place by being entwined at each hole made by the needle. It is a simple but very neat and durable seam, and a machine capable of quickly producing one will improve the efficiency of clothing production.
column4: A lockstitch seam is one consisting of two threads on opposite sides of the cloth, held in place by being entwined at each hole made by the needle. It is a simple but very neat and durable seam, and a machine capable of quickly producing one will improve the efficiency of clothing production.

column2: Jigs are frames, adjustable stands and other devices used to guide active tools like drills and saws, allowing for precision and repeatability.
column4: Die Einführung von Einspannvorrichtungen steigerte die Effizienz aller Maschinen enorm, was wiederum die Produktion der meisten Industriegüter steigerte.

column2: Band saws offer an advantage over circular saws both in being able to make curved cuts and in having a smaller cut width, wasting less wood as sawdust.
column4: Band saws offer an advantage over circular saws both in being able to make curved cuts and in having a smaller cut width, wasting less wood as sawdust.

column2: This was the first fully automatic loom, improving on earlier semi-automatic looms by adding an automatic loading mechanism to replace empty shuttles without any operator action. It allowed a single worker to operate up to 16 looms at once.
column4: This was the first fully automatic loom, improving on earlier semi-automatic looms by adding an automatic loading mechanism to replace empty shuttles without any operator action. It allowed a single worker to operate up to 16 looms at once.

column2: The overlock pattern consists of two parallel seams connected by a crisscrossing third seam. It is a very durable pattern. Machines capable of producing such a pattern will efficiently produce clothing of high quality.
column4: The overlock pattern consists of two parallel seams connected by a crisscrossing third seam. It is a very durable pattern. Machines capable of producing such a pattern will efficiently produce clothing of high quality.

column2: The assembly line enhances many manufacturing processes, but particularly ones that consist of a sequence of mechanically simple actions, such as packaging.
column4: The assembly line enhances many manufacturing processes, but particularly ones that consist of a sequence of mechanically simple actions, such as packaging.

column2: This was a machine that mechanically rolled molten glass into flat panes, allowing for efficient mass production of windows.
column4: This was a machine that mechanically rolled molten glass into flat panes, allowing for efficient mass production of windows.

column2: Mechanization of the act of glassblowing itself increased the output of the glassware industry tremendously.
column4: Mechanization of the act of glassblowing itself increased the output of the glassware industry tremendously.

column2: The rotary kiln allowed for cement to be heated with higher thermal efficiency than before, while simultaneously being mixed, with continuous feeding of raw material and removal of final cement. Its introduction increased both the quality and quantity of cement produced.
column4: The rotary kiln allowed for cement to be heated with higher thermal efficiency than before, while simultaneously being mixed, with continuous feeding of raw material and removal of final cement. Its introduction increased both the quality and quantity of cement produced.

column2: By using calcium sulphate as the reactive ingredient, Portland cement yielded concrete that was both stronger and faster to settle than earlier formulas.
column4: By using calcium sulphate as the reactive ingredient, Portland cement yielded concrete that was both stronger and faster to settle than earlier formulas.

column2: Smokeless powder is gunpowder that combusts almost completely, leaving neither ash to foul the barrel nor smoke to impair vision on the battlefield. Not having to clean the barrel between shots greatly increases potential rates of fire.
column4: Smokeless powder is gunpowder that combusts almost completely, leaving neither ash to foul the barrel nor smoke to impair vision on the battlefield. Not having to clean the barrel between shots greatly increases potential rates of fire.

column2: The Kraft process is a chemical process using sodium hydroxide and sulfide to break down wood into pulp. Contrary to earlier processes, it allows for most of the pulping chemicals to be recovered afterwards. Simply put, our paper industry has developed a way to have its cake and eat it too!
column4: The Kraft process is a chemical process using sodium hydroxide and sulfide to break down wood into pulp. Contrary to earlier processes, it allows for most of the pulping chemicals to be recovered afterwards. Simply put, our paper industry has developed a way to have its cake and eat it too!

column2: Relatively cheap and easy to produce industrially, aspirin was one of the first mass-produced pharmaceutical products.
column4: Relatively cheap and easy to produce industrially, aspirin was one of the first mass-produced pharmaceutical products.

column2: Electromagnetic shielding, twisted pairs, differential transmission, and other methods of noise reduction can be used to allow for signal transmission over longer distances, and for more precise functionality in electric systems.
column4: Electromagnetic shielding, twisted pairs, differential transmission, and other methods of noise reduction can be used to allow for signal transmission over longer distances, and for more precise functionality in electric systems.

column2: Cracking is the breaking of large hydrocarbons into smaller parts. It allows for heavy, thick, ungainly oils to be turned into more fluid ones, improving the quality of refined fuel.
column4: Cracking is the breaking of large hydrocarbons into smaller parts. It allows for heavy, thick, ungainly oils to be turned into more fluid ones, improving the quality of refined fuel.

column2: A vacuum tube is a device where thermal emission is used to cause a controllable current. Different kinds of vacuum tubes can, in a fairly rudimentary way, fulfil the function of a diode or a transistor, allowing for actual electronics for the first time.
column4: A vacuum tube is a device where thermal emission is used to cause a controllable current. Different kinds of vacuum tubes can, in a fairly rudimentary way, fulfil the function of a diode or a transistor, allowing for actual electronics for the first time.

column2: A rotary printing press uses a rotating, cylindrical press-head to imprint images on paper. This allows for continuous paper feed and much more efficient printing than with a classical flat-surface press.

Lithography is a printing method where hydrophobic and hydrophilic chemicals are used to control which parts of a printing plate ink sticks to. In many production processes, it allows for higher efficiency and versatility than using movable type.
Synthetic detergents can be used instead of soap for cleaning, and have several useful properties such as being less affected by hard water.

By continuously adding inputs, extracting final products and regulating and adjusting the process in real-time, a chemical manufacturing process can be made much more efficient than what could be achieved using batch methods.
A turbine allows for more efficient conversion of thermal energy to rotational mechanical energy than a reciprocating piston, and is thus ideally suited for use in a power plant.
A transformer converts alternating current from high-voltage to high-current and vice versa, allowing it to be transmitted over long distances at minimal power loss.
